With DBD's new release of the Silent Hill DLC, I had to put out a review that I've been sitting on for awhile now. If I could give this game an 'eh' rating with a 'maybe if it's on sale buy it if you feel like a few good games' I would. Now I don't have hundreds of hours on DBD like others do but I have a fair amount that I feel like I should say something.  The game is a mess at times, pushing cosmetic items that you pay real money for instead of in game currency, to releasing DLC's for killers that sometimes are good, sometimes are bad. This game has always had issues. Or grinding how ever many hours just to unlock a killer with in game currency or a singular cosmetic item.  The game is buggy, preventing you from ranking up, sometimes it's the hit boxes, sometimes it's you DCing unintentionally and losing your rank that easily. It's annoying and disappointing at the same time considering how fun the game is when there isn't bugs preventing you from being downed or even getting into the game.  The matchmaking is beyond annoying when it comes to the ranking. Being put in with greys to purples and reds when you aren't anywhere close to that rank. Then those people diss you at the end of the match or choose to not help you if you accidently stab them after missing a skill check to heal them(because you're clearly a grey rank and just getting the hang of things)  With that being said, don't get me started on the community. That's one reason why I haven't played it as much as I had prior. You do such a small thing like loop a killer, or manage to get out of their sight and YOURE suddenly the bad guy for playing your part as the survivor. Some will camp you on the hook, some will DC on you, some will tunnel you. I'm a survivor main and at this point it's just plain frustrating to be completely honest. It kills the game for me.  Not to mention how much crap people give you if you play with friends. Despite the game HAVING THE OPTION, it's looked down upon to other players for whatever reason. Claiming it's an 'unfair a

The developers have gotten better, but there are still a LOT of problems with this game.
fun

Very fun game, there are a lot of interesting mechanics to master, which is pretty cool, especially for a survival horror game.  Like every game though, it does have some issues.  The community can be annoying, and survivors and killers alike can get mad at you for "not letting them have fun".  If I'm playing killer, I would like it if you had fun, but my objective is to win (just like most games).  Not saying you should camp or tunnel, that can be scummy, but the other side is not obligated to make sure you have fun.  With that said, the Dead by Daylight community is still pretty damn good compared to others.  The only other issue I've noticed are the maps, which can be pretty unbalanced, partly due to their semi-auto generated nature.  Not only are some maps too big or too small, but 1 window spawning in a certain place can make the game a pain for killers, and 1 window not spawning in a certain place can make the game a pain for survivors.  Those are my only problems with the game, everything else is solid, and I highly recommend.

Haven't played it for too long so I can't really talk too much about the toxicity. I only ran into one guy who was rude who after i said "gg, I suck nuts" when all the survivors got away, responded with "that's your problem not mine. sry" which really isn't bad anyway just kinda rude.

But from of what I have experienced it's a fun game for horror fans (especially slasher fans, if you're willing to drop some cash on dlc you can play as ghostface, pighead, leatherface, freddy and michael myers) but definitely a fun game to play with your friends. Even if you are just playing alone you'll still have a lot of fun. You will definitely die a lot at first though which can be frustrating.

But because there really are only two game modes, survivor and killer, 20 bucks may be a bit steep if you're just looking for a fun game with friends. Because of that i suggest picking up a key for the game on G2A. there should be a lot of them on there for cheap cause the summer sale just ended.

Hope this helps :)

I highly recommend this game. Fun to play with and against friends. I have the majority of my hours in survivor, but I have been playing a little bit of killer. Only flaws are: 

1. Since it's a pvp game, you might have teammates or someone playing on the other side who take the fun out of it (i.e. camping/tunneling killers, toxic 4 man swf, teammates who won't do gens/go for saves, someone who decides to DC/kill themselves on first hook, etc).

2. Sometimes matchmaking is borked (i.e. As a solo red rank survivor, I've ended up in a match with yellow rank survivors and killer.  As a yellow rank killer, I've had two red ranks and two green rank survivors in a match. Yellow rank is a couple tiers below red, so it's kinda like placing someone who's played a little bit with someone who's supposed to know what they're doing.)

If you're on the fence about whether or not to get it, wait for a free weekend and play it for at least two hours. Only reason I'm emphasizing at least two hours is so that you'll get a good amount of games to get a better gist of what types of matches you can get (and if your first few matches sucks, then you don't get scared away).

On one hand, the game's really fun.

On the other, the high ranks are nearly impossible for killers to win if the survivors are playing most-optimally. This isn't a killer rant, this is more of a mixed Surv/Killer player just gathering what's been talked about for a while.

I recommend the game, but, well, be warned if you wanna tryhard it for either side.
